title: Spoken Word and Slam Poetry
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Spoken Word and Slam Poetry.

hook.text: In a Chicago bar in 1986, construction worker Marc Smith invented the poetry slam. Judges were random audience members.

discovery.text: It brought poetry back to its oral roots â€” voice, body, and audience response matter as much as words on a page.

twist.text: Critics call it anti-literary. Fans call it poetry for people who don't read poetry. Both might be right.

climax.text: Slam poetry created stars like Sarah Kay, Phil Kaye, and Neil Hilborn â€” poets with millions of YouTube views.

punchline.text: Poetry left the page and found a stage.
